ai-ud3.5:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud3.5:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākappina was sitting not far from the Buddha cross-legged, with his body straight and mindfulness of the body well-established in himself.
ai-ud3.5:1.4_0: The Buddha saw him meditating there.
ai-ud3.5:2.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud3.5:3.2_0: restrained in the six fields of contact,
ai-ud3.5:3.3_0: a mendicant always immersed in samādhi
